author: R Sivaraman
text:
Miraya Vadra in action at the 42nd Sub-Junior National Basketball Championship against Karnataka in Puducherry on Friday. A pet dog of an organiser is being taken inside the courts.— Photos: T. Singaravelou

In spite of a spirited performance by Priyanka Gandhi’s daughter Miraya, her Haryana team lost to Karnataka on Friday at the 42nd Sub-Junior National Basketball Championship as the tournament entered the crucial knockout stages.

The silver lining was that the Haryana team entered into pre-quarterfinals and will live to fight another day on Saturday.

Ms. Priyanka and her daughter have been camping in Puducherry for the participation in the championships. Though her appearance has been widely anticipated, Ms. Priyanka has not yet ventured to visit the venue.

After a loss to the Kerala girls by 63-45 in the third league, Haryana had a lot to play for in the match against Karnataka. In the third quarter, Miraya was allowed a free throw by referee and she scored.

Karnataka scored 69 to Haryana’s final tally of 47.

Mathab Singh, coach of Haryana girls team said the team was not able to win because two players in team were ill.

Miraya’s team will next face Telangana in their pre-quarterfinal match.

Meanwhile, some members of the audience have complained of poor air-conditioning at the venue. Someone even walked a pet dog inside the venue.
title: Miraya performs well, but Haryana loses to Karnataka
